questions.question: Why is the soil sample compacted to a bulk density similar to that of site from which the sample is obtained from?

answers.b: To give an accurate representation of the site soil as bulk density affects permeability
answers.c: To not to change the void ratio from site

questions.question: What kinds of soils are suitable for Falling Head Permeability Test?
Why is a constant head maintained in constant head test?

answers.a: To ensure same velocity of water through the soil with respect to time
answers.b: To ensure the manometer readings are same
answers.c: To ensure the soil doesn’t get washed off

questions.question: What is the standard temperature at which permeability is to be measured according to Indian Standards
What is the special property of the material used for filler disks

answers.a: Velocity is proportional to hydraulic gradient
answers.b: Discharge rate is proportion to head
answers.c: Velocity is inversely proportional to hydraulic gradient
answers.d: Discharge rate is inversely proportional to head

questions.question: Soils with hydraulic conductivity  between 10<sup>-5</sup> and 10<sup>-11</sup> are known as
What is the relation between the texture of the soil and the hydraulic conductivity?

answers.a: Finer the soil higher the hydraulic conductivity
answers.b: Finer the soil lower the hydraulic conductivity

questions.question: Why is the water used for the test de-aired?

answers.c: So that external particles don’t interfere in the test
answers.d: In order to make sure the flow is as steady as possible
